intro: Peritris ovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf peritris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its ovate, glossy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical climates.
